result.execSummary:
The defendant Leslie M Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
Pay supervision fees.

No contact with firearms.

Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
  Defendant was told that if the victim contacts her she is to ignore it, if the behavior continues to contact her, she should file an injunction.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leslie M Smith in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant Leslie M Smith in custody.  Peter A. Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
As to counts 2 and 4:
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months on each count in the House of Correction, each count is consecutive to each other, with credit for 26 days on count 2. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 24 months, concurrent,  with the following conditions:

- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
  Defendant was told that if the victim contacts her she is to ignore it, if the behavior continues to contact her, she should file an injunction.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.

Court advises the defendant he may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  
Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Defense counsel came into court asking for an earlier date for a sentencing hearing.
Case calendared for a sentencing date on 10/29/2015 at 08:30 a.m.
Defense to notify the district attorney.
Bailiff Tackacs in court notified to have the defendant produced from the House of Correction.

cab
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.

Defendant Leslie M Smith in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for final pre-trial however, parties have reached a resolution.

As to Counts 2 and 4:   Defendant changes her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

As to Counts 1 and 3: Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court ordered these counts dismissed and read-in to the case for the purposes of sentencing.

Court ordered the jury trial date of 08/19/2015 vacated.  Same conditions of bail apply. Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Leslie M Smith in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called, not scheduled for court today. Case called at request of parties to address the issues of joinder. Court GRANTED joinder of 15CM1781 & 15CM948. Case remains set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trail in branch 36.
Received & Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report: New Arrest.
turnover to Justice Point with ordered conditions.

Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $500.00 Signature Bond with turnover to Justice Point for Supervision. Absolute Sobriety, to be monitored by drug testing and breathalyzers.  No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No firearms or dangerous weapons. Comply with no contact order.

Defendant Leslie M Smith in court with attorney Thomas K. Hackbart.  Defendant Leslie M Smith in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Darryll H.; Tony D. or their residences

Defendant Leslie M Smith in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Leslie M Smith in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Status conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
